content.description: Small slightly overhanging black varnished face. Have you ever experienced crimping pain through the fingertips.. well this is the route! Sit start on small pockets/crimps climb straight up through small technical crimpers to an 'okay' mantel top out, add sand if you want extra spice for the follower. >;)
content.protection: Use a few pads as there is a hole just to the right of this route.
content.location: Located on the Wee Man boulder up and left from the Death Scream Boulder when following the trail

content.description: A fun steep route in the same area as Shindig. Start left hand in a deep mono, right hand on a good flake. Work your way up the rail and out of the cave.
content.location: If you are looking at Shindig it’s directly behind you.

content.description: Sit start on an undercling/sidepull jug and work up until you can bust up to some juggy knobs. climbs just right of the arete!
content.location: Located on Eye of the Beholder boulder.

content.description: A nice warm up problem but it is too short.
content.location: There is a streaked undercling near the right edge of the boulder. Do a sit start on edges and climb to the undercling. Top out on some slightly slopey holds.

content.description:
Start under the roof matched on the jug rail as far back as you can. Do some fun and interesting roof climbing to gain the giant cinderblock sized sloper jug at head height. Take a breath, shake, and get psyched to finish up the amazing face with great moves the whole way. Classic!!

Oh, and the rock is absolutely bullet.

***Update- Refined beta involves going more direct bringing the grade down in the v7 range.
content.location: 60 seconds from the road. Thor's Hammer is about 200 yards upcanyon from the cabin and parking for the Death Scream area. The boulder is directly across the road from the upcanyon end of the mine. Park near the upcanyon end of the mine and walk across the road toward a small jumble of unimpressive looking boulders. Thor's Hammer is hiding inside the jumble. A perfect new edition for the roadside circuit.

content.description: Right off the trail with a cool looking start.  It starts sitting on some opposing potato grips, typical for the area.  There are multiple ways of doing this.  Most commonly done as a low compression problem, or as a dynamic throw to the good left hand above.  Once you stick the good holds, continue up on big jugs to an easy mantle. A lowball but, surprisingly, a pretty fun little problem!
content.location: Wander up the hill past Proppa Dyno to Playmate.  When you reach Playmate, turn R and start wandering along the cliff band.  You'll pass Sam's Oliphant (tufa that looks like an elephants head and trunk) and then run directly intoTufa Land (low compression problem that looks like a tiny Playmate).

content.description: This problem starts low on crimps and climbs up right to a technical topout. Be careful to stay off of the boulder to the left to keep the problem at its grade.
content.protection: Crash Pad or two and spotter
content.location: Hike to the Battletoads boulder and then hike down the left side of the boulder into a small gully. The problem starts on the right side of the two boulders

content.description: This variation to Shindig uses a perfect sloping ripple hold to climb straight up out of a pod. Keeping body tension as you escape the pod is the crux. Superior rock quality!
content.location: Start sitting on some flakes in a pod near the junction of two boulders. Climb to up and out of the pod.

content.description:
AKA:

Electric Fence

- A classic, old school problem similar to the popular Self Service in New Joe's. It is old school in that it starts sitting and tops out around 8 feet high. Shindig is classic in that the heel hooks, sloper slaps, and feet cutting loose moves are sooo good. It is steep and traverses a bit so there is more than 8 feet of climbing. Superior rock quality!
content.location: Start sitting on some flakes in a pod near the junction of two boulders. Climb to the right following the edge of a water polished face.

content.description:
Fun problem, with a stellar view from high up the canyon. Climb through the elephant truck tufa to a little bit of a dirty top out.

Watch what you grab towards the last 5 feet, the hueco's are quite thin, and it looks like some breakage has happened recently. It would suck for a hold to blow while you're up there!
content.protection: A few pads and a good spotter is great. The problem is pretty easy, but the landing is not ideal
content.location:
Can be seen from the road... if you have binoculars.

Walk up through the Cabin Fever(aka Death Scream, aka The Perimeter) area, zig-zagging up the hill until you reach the light colored cliffs at the top.

Start matched on the undercling and go straight up from there

content.description:
This sweet little vertical line will test your crimp strength and technique. At first glance, the holds seems obvious, but piecing them together in the right sequence proves to be trickier than expected.

Start with your left hand on an edge at 5 feet and your right on a slimper sidepull slightly higher and to the right. Attain the crimp above via some technical trickery and proceed onwards towards the lips via gastons and sloping edges.

A final committing move to the top caps off this stellar climb!
content.protection: A few pads are nice. It would also be ideal to have a spotter standing on the rock slab behind you to help redirect you in case you fell during the last couple of moves.
content.location: This climb is on the right side of the vertical face that is to the left (and around the corner) of Battletoads.

content.description: A beautiful vertical line of edges and sidepulls. Proppa Dyno climbs very smoothly, and has an awesome committing dynamic move near the top.
content.protection: 2 pads, maybe 3. Good landing, but it's kind of tall.
content.location: On the first boulder you come to in the Cabin Fever Area (Aka The Perimeter, aka The Death Scream Area). Proppa Dyno is in the center of the face left of Death Scream and Death Proof.

content.description:
Holy boobs!

This problem starts sitting on opposing holds and makes a hard move to the boobs. After matching the boobs grab a smaller boob with lh and begin the crux right hand bumps. Easy lip encounter.
content.location: Up the trail from Death Scream

content.description: Spooky! Start low in the obvious slot jug and make some weird/hard moves to an airy top out.
content.location: Around the corner to the left if you’re facing Playmates of the Year

content.description: Stand start holding onto huge tufas. Climb straight up and mantle over the top of the boulder. Watch out for possible weak holds.
content.location: Directly right of Sam's Oliphant.

content.description:
Stand start with both hands matched on a slopey sidepull/rail feature.

Use some very technical trickery to pull off the ground and stick a hard deadpoint to a big slopey edge. A few more tenuous moves lead to a somewhat tricky top out.

Without good beta, this can feel quite hard for the grade.
content.protection: A few pads to level out the landing are ideal. A spotter is nice too.
content.location: To the left of both Battletoads and Rash, on the left side of the obvious vertical wall.

content.description: Start matched on the farthest most jug on the obvious slopy rail, follow the two ovular huecos and go straight up the apex of the prow, top out on slab.
content.location: Right fork, the ridge above playmate of the year, two problems right of the elephant trunk.

content.description: Fun steep climbing to a mantle crux. Perfect rock.
content.location: Walk 5 minutes uphill from Battletoads.

content.description: Climb the giant right facing flake jug until it runs out. Make a move out left to a cobble stone and pocket. Surmount the bulge on cobbles.
content.location: Walk uphill from Battletoads for 2 minutes and head left toward a small beige, sandy cliff band littered with cobble stones. Knob Snob is on the far left side of the chossy cliff band. This is the best rock the little cliff band has to offer and the rock quality of this problem is actually very good. There is an obvious landing built for this boulder problem.

content.description: Big, scary, and classic! The mantle at the top is not hard but it is very committing.
content.protection: Many pads. The drop zone is clean and a posse of pads makes this very safe.
content.location: Go around the corner, down canyon, from Death Scream and up the hill for 5 minutes.

content.description: Climb a high face with holds that get bigger the higher you climb.
content.location: This boulder problems starts on the smooth, water streaked bulge. Find a two finger pocket for the right hand and something else for the left. Do a cross through move to start thing off.

content.description: One of the more incredible looking features you'll see and an enjoyable climb that will clean up nice with traffic. Start on right hand slopey crimp back near the base of the cliff line with foot on big sandy block a couple feet under the roof.   Very difficult and tensiony moves getting out of there and then you can ride a heel up through positive jugs and underclings.  Save some gas for an airy and delicate finish.  Low start to "O Face"
content.location: 2 minutes above Playmate

content.description: Sick compression climbing! It starts sitting with a low lh side pull and a higher rh side pull. A couple HARD narrow compression moves leads to a big span to a lh hueco then jugs. I really enjoyed this one, great rock and moves.
content.protection: 3 pads or so. There is a dab rock for the end sequence so a thin pad could be nice.
content.location: From playmate of the year continue up hill for 5 more minutes.

content.description: Sit start.  Lieback your way up the sidepull flake.  Top out is a little spicier than Twilight without obvious jugs to grab.
content.protection: A pad or two and a spotter
content.location: Wander up the hill past Proppa Dyno to Playmate.  When you reach Playmate, turn R and start wandering along the cliff band.  You'll pass Sam's Oliphant (tufa that looks like an elephants head and trunk) and Tufa Land (low compression problem that looks like a tiny Playmate) until you reach the Eye of the Beholder boulder.   Just to the right of this 10 is Twilight Delight and just to the right of that is this large lieback.

content.description:
Starts low on a left and side pull and a right hand undercling. Bust out left to a good jug and then fire to the knob on the lip for an easy finish and maybe one point.

Inspired by terrible east coast low balls
content.location: Directly left of Wee Man

content.description: Start on slopey edges. Move to a sharp crimp rail. Grab jug out right  without dabbing and top out on good edges.
content.location: Death Scream Boulder

content.description: How you feelin'? Strong, invincible, even young? How bout death proof. Begin dis kevlar skinned route up in tha same pod as fo' Proppa Dyno n' work right into tha undercling. Make big-ass moves ta lil' small-ass crimps, mantel n' bellow yo' death proof blow as you have survived this one!
content.protection: Tall boulder at least 3 pads and some spotters for the drop off/rock
content.location: Center face of Death Scream

content.description: Sit start on side pulls. Climb up into a crack and follow to an easy topout.
content.location: On the Wee Man boulder - Right side

content.description: Climb the on the good rock to the right of Gnarler until in deteriorates into ugly looking stuff.
content.location: Start on a big flat edge near the right end of the boulder. Climb up through some good pockets then hit the ugly looking rock.

content.description: A short face with a sit start. Climb on pockets and like them all.
content.location: This is located on the northern hillside.

content.description: This is the Beautiful arete behind Playmate of the Year. It starts matched on the good hold on the right side of the arete, slap left hand around the corner and begin heel hooking. After the first 3 moves it heads right to a mailslot then the lip.
content.location: Up the trail from deathscream, right behind playmate.

content.description: Start matched on a slopey seam then work right to 2 good crimps at head height. Go right towards the big slopes and then top out. Tricky
content.location: Opposite side of the boulder if standing at Death Scream
